newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: EU to press request for WTO panel on Helms-Burton.
newsitem.headline: EU to press request for WTO panel on Helms-Burton.

text.p: The European Union will on Wednesday press its request for a World Trade Organisation (WTO) dispute panel on the U.S. Helms-Burton law aimed at reducing foreign investments in Cuba, an EU official said.
The official was speaking before a meeting of the WTO's Dispute Settlement Body (DSB) at which creation of a panel will be approved automatically as long as the EU maintains its demand.
"We have seen no change in the U.S. position, so we will be going ahead," the official told Reuters.

U.S. officials indicated that Washington's trade ambassador Booth Gardner would be arguing that the law, signed by President Bill Clinton at the start of his re-election campaign at the start of this year, was currently in suspense and did not have a wide-ranging effect.

The United States is also expected to say that its move against communist-ruled Cuba was taken in its national security interests -- an argument some trade analysts say is covered by an article in the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (GATT) which underpinned the WTO.
The EU argues that the law, named for its congressional sponsors and widely condemned by nearly all U.S. trade partners, runs counter to a range of WTO rules.
